repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -118,6 +118,56 @@ function vim.stricmp(a, b) end
 --- @param use_utf16? any
 function vim.str_byteindex(str, index, use_utf16) end
 
+--- Returns a list of each character's starting byte position in the string
+--- based on the UTF-8 encoding.
+--- 
+--- Embedded NUL bytes are treated as terminating the string.
+--- @param str string
+--- @return table
+function vim.str_utf_pos(str) end
+
+--- Returns the byte offset to the first byte of the current character
+--- pointed into by the offset
+--- 
+--- Examples:
+--- <pre>lua
+---
+--- ---

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
--- -- Returns 0 because the first character of the string is the starting
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -118,6 +118,56 @@ function vim.stricmp(a, b) end
 --- @param use_utf16? any
 function vim.str_byteindex(str, index, use_utf16) end
 
+--- Returns a list of each character's starting byte position in the string
+--- based on the UTF-8 encoding.
+--- 
+--- Embedded NUL bytes are treated as terminating the string.
+--- @param str string
+--- @return table
+function vim.str_utf_pos(str) end
+
+--- Returns the byte offset to the first byte of the current character
+--- pointed into by the offset

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
--- -- Returns -1 because the second character of the string is one more than
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -118,6 +118,56 @@ function vim.stricmp(a, b) end
 --- @param use_utf16? any
 function vim.str_byteindex(str, index, use_utf16) end
 
+--- Returns a list of each character's starting byte position in the string
+--- based on the UTF-8 encoding.
+--- 
+--- Embedded NUL bytes are treated as terminating the string.
+--- @param str string
+--- @return table
+function vim.str_utf_pos(str) end
+
+--- Returns the byte offset to the first byte of the current character
+--- pointed into by the offset
+--- 
+--- Examples:
+--- <pre>lua
+---
+--- ---
+--- -- Returns 0 because the 1 character of the string is the starting
+--- -- byte of the 'æ' character
+--- vim.str_utf_start('æ',1)
+--- 
+--- -- Returns -1 because the 2 character of the string is one more than

@@ -118,6 +118,56 @@ function vim.stricmp(a, b) end --- @param use_utf16? any function vim.str_byteindex(str, index, use_utf16) end +--- Returns a list of each character's starting byte position in the string +--- based on the UTF-8 encoding. +--- +--- Embedded NUL bytes are treated as terminating the string. +--- @param str string +--- @return table +function vim.str_utf_pos(str) end + +--- Returns the byte offset to the first byte of the current character +--- pointed into by the offset +--- +--- Examples: +--- 
lua
+---
+--- ---
+--- -- Returns 0 because the 1 character of the string is the starting
+--- -- byte of the 'æ' character
+--- vim.str_utf_start('æ',1)
+--- 
+--- -- Returns -1 because the 2 character of the string is one more than
+--- -- the starting byte of the 'æ' character
+--- vim.str_utf_start('æ',2)
+---

```suggestion
--- Gets a list of byte positions of each char in the given UTF-8 encoded string.
```

comment_regular_data.body: Please run `stylua` (or manually fix the lint error) and squash your commits. (Pro tip: never create a PR from your default branch, always make a feature branch first; otherwise maintainers cannot push fixes to your PRs.)
